briefTitle: A Comparison of Subject-administered Romosozumab With Healthcare Provider-administered Romosozumab for Osteoporosis
officialTitle: A Randomized, Multicenter, Open-label, Parallel Group Study in Postmenopausal Women With Osteoporosis to Evaluate the Noninferiority of Subject-administered Romosozumab Via Autoinjector/Pen vs Healthcare Provider-administered Romosozumab Via Prefilled Syringe
summary: To evaluate the noninferiority of a 6-month treatment with 210 mg romosozumab at 90 mg/mL administered subcutaneously (SC) once a month (QM) in postmenopausal women with osteoporosis either by healthcare provider (HCP) administration with prefilled syringe (PFS) or by subject self-administration with autoinjector/pen (AI/Pen)

primaryOutcome.measure: Percent Change From Baseline in Lumbar Spine BMD at Month 6
